inn1.comm: starts accurately, pitched up and a hint of away movement, defended off the front foot towards mid-off
shuffles across and taps the ball towards midwicket, sets off for a quick single
length ball on middle stump, Hughes plays that from within the crease, defended down the track
short of length ball just outside off, defended towards cover
drops it a touch short, Hughes latches on to that, whipped away towards deep midwicket for four, that one sat up even at Steyn's pace
far less convincing boundary this time, Steyn fires it wide outside off, Hughes lashes out at that, flies wide of gully for four, for a moment it seemed the fielder there had a chance
flighted from round the wicket, full and that is driven off the front foot towards mid-off
spins in quite a bit after pitching just outside off, chops this off the back foot, from the line of middle stump
gives this one plenty of air, doesn't land before reaching the batsman, Finch tucks that away towards midwicket for two
length ball on middle stump, driven towards cover this time, 'Wait on,' Finch shouts after the shot
Duminy flighting it quite a bit in this over, a crisp drive towards cover, a diving stop by Faf du Plessis
on the pads, clipped towards square leg by Finch
back of length outside off and Hughes cuts it late past point in the gap for three runs
straighter delivery from short of length outside off, inside edge thuds onto Finch's pads
brings it in with the angle this time from length, Finch defends by closing the bat angle on the leg side
back of length outside off, he hops back to defend it back
seams in from short of length towards off stumps, defends off the back foot again
outside off, Finch runs it down to third man to keep strike
bit of flight towards leg stump, takes the pad instead of the bat
fuller on leg stump, driven down the ground to long-on
tossed up on the leg side, tucked off the pads behind square for one
full on off, driven firmly to mid-off where a misfield from Morkel concedes an easy single
slightly flatter on leg stump, pushed to midwicket

mix up, chance for a rune out, but missed! It was going towards middle and leg and Hughes pushed it just behind square on leg but did not respond to Finch's call, who was halfway down the pitch. But de Kock could not pick up the ball on first attempt and Finch was back on time
back of length outside off, he defends off the back foot
touch fuller just outside off stump, he defends it back to Steyn
stifled appeal, but not from Steyn, as this one nipped in after pitching and hit the front pad in front off middle, but he was on his toes and it was going over
length delivery outside off, it's not too wide but Hughes goes for a big swish-cum-drive-cum-cut and misses, good carry for the keeper
towards off stump and Hughes defends it on leg side off the front foot
fuller outside off and Hughes taps it close to himself on the off side and calls for a quick single
flighted on middle and leg and Hughes targets the backward square leg boundary with a sweep and finds it easily for four
comes in instead of turning away off length after pitching outside off, Hughes just got an inside
outside off on length, defends it back this time
he finally gets the room for a cut and gets a boundary on the other side now. He went back to let it turn, or not, and cut it past backward point for four. No third man
on leg stump this time, tucked to midwicket with a lean forward
flatter and shorter towards leg side, helped to leg gully by going back
continues with back of length outside off, Finch defends it back
on length now towards off, Finch pushes it softly towards mid-on and calls for a quick single, and a misfield from mid-on makes it easier
angles it away from off stump, it was short of length and Hughes pulled but missed. It didn't bounce as much as he expected
length delivery outside off now, tapped past cover point for an easy single
tries another pull, an awkward one this time, and misses again! It was on back of length outside off and hit the back thigh pad outside off to go to Amla at slip
much fuller outside off now, driven down to mid-off
just around length outside off, left alone by the batsman
angled in this time towards leg stump, he tries to glance but can't time it properly
around length back to outside off, defends off the back foot to cover
loud appeal for lbw from Morkel, but it hit Finch when he was in the air and above the knee roll after the ball came in sharply from back  of length
angles it in sharply again towards the pads, Finch still can't get it away but gets a leg bye
angles in towards Hughes' leg stump now, he also gets a leg bye on the leg side
on length outside off, Hughes defends it back
much fuller on the leg stump and it's flicked away to deep backward square leg for two
on length outside off, Hughes pushes it to cover
pitches it shorter and a bit wider, Hughes cuts it a bit late to third man
length delivery outside off stump, turned to the leg side where short midwicket dives to his left to stop it
shorter and wider again, run down to third man for one
tries an extravagant drive outside off for the length delivery and it seams in to beat the bat
angles it into the batsman from short of length, Finch tucks it off his toes to square leg
shorter and straighter, Finch stays back and pulls it in the gap well behind square on the leg side for his first boundary
better delivery - on length outside off and Finch defends to cover
angled in again form back of length towards off stump, Finch hops back to defend it back
towards the leg stump now and he tucks it off the pads to deep fine leg for one
slightly full on the leg stump, Hughes helps it with the angle down to deep fine leg
length delivery outside off, Finch opens the face of the bat on the off side and gets it past point

oh Finch has given it away! It was full and wide and Finch probably got tempted, went for a big lofted drive on the off side but holed out straight to the man in the deep for an easy catch. He wanted to break the shackles, but could not
too full on the pads again, tucked away to deep midwicket for one
slightly full around off stump, turned to the leg side
slightly shorter and cutting in from outside off, Smith pushes it down the ground
bangs it in towards off stump, tucked off the back foot towards midwicket
on length on the middle stump, turned past mid-on for one as Morkel tumbles in his follow through but got up immediately like a stunt man
angled in towards off stump from short of length, tapped towards midwicket for one to bring up Australia's 50
bangs it in outside off, Smith defends it close to himself
goes full this time on the pads and Smith drives it with great timing off the pads for a four right between mid on and midwicket
swings it in from well outside off, Smith shoulders arms
another cut from Hughes and missed again! He went a bit towards off stump for the short of length delivery but it cut in and went under the bat
too full on middle and leg to trouble him and it's tucked away easily for one on the leg side
length delivery angled in towards off stump, defends it down the ground to mid-on
touch wider outside off but not much room and he defends it back again
goes a bit shorter and Smith gets the time to tap it to deep fine leg for two
angled towards off stump now, he looked to play it on the leg side but couldn't connect and was hit on the pad
flighted around off stump, pushed to cover by Hughes
a half-tracker now from Tahir and it's pulled to deep midwicket
flat and outside off on length, defends off the back foot
fuller outside off and driven to extra cover now
flatter and straighter on the off stump, Smith goes back to defend it
slower through the air with flight on off stump, Smith waits and defends watchfully
length delivery outside off and Hughes moves across to close the face of the bat and tucks it towards square leg for one
full and wide and Smith cashes in by driving it beautifully through the covers for a handsome drive! super shot for four
slightly full outside off and it's pushed down to mid-off
slow offcutter outside off on length and Smith defends it carefully
slower again an it cuts towards off middle and leg and strikes him high on the pad as Smith looked to push it on the leg side
angled in towards middle and leg, tucked with the angle to deep fine leg for two quick runs
flighted outside off, he comes down and takes it on the full to drive it down to long-on
flighted outside off for Smith too, he also uses his feet and drives it down to his long-on
closer to off stump and Hughes defends it back
he produces the googly by pitching in on leg and it turns a long way, Hughes cuts it to short third man
short of length on leg stump, Smith lets it turn by going back and taps it to midwicket
fullish on the off stump, swept with the turn to deep fine leg as Tahir holds his head with both hands
turning in towards off stump, tucked off the back foot to the leg side
comes down the track and takes it on the pad outside off
short of length outside off, pushed off the back foot to deep cover
flight and turn towards off stump, helped with the turn to square leg
short, wide and turning away and Smith cuts it to deep point
flighted outside off, defends with soft hands towards point for a quick single
short and flat outside off, pulled down to long-on
flighted on off stump, turned to midwicket with the wrists
seemed like a googly outside off, he defends to cover
makes room for his favourite cut again but is beaten outside off
touch fuller and it's pushed to cover point this time
full and flighted outside off, thick edge off the drive goes down fine on the off side for four and that's time for drinks
he comes down to defend outside off and the ball lobs off the pad towards short leg where QDK dives to catch it and appeal. Was there bat? Doesn't look like
short and outside off, cut straight to point
on length towards off stump, Smith blocks it back
full on leg this time, driven off the pads on the leg side
flighted on length just outside off, helped with the turn to midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut off the back foot to sweeper cover
fullish and outside off, pushed to cover by Smith
closer to off stump on length, Smith defends it back to the bowler
goes shorter on middle and leg, smith goes back and tucks it to the leg side
short and outside off and Hughes cuts it late delicately on the off side as Morkel runs to the boundary and slides to save a run
comes down and taps the ball from length down to mid-on
googly with slight turn from outside off, tapped late to short third man for one
pitched up and that is whipped away towards deep midwicket, Smith charges down the track before playing that shot, and immediately called for two
backs away and looks to chop the ball off the back foot, bottom edge bounces through to the keeper
turns away after pitching on a length, Smith pushes forward at it, off the outside edge towards gully

similar to the first ball of this over, Smith again skates down the track and stylishly sends the ball towards deep midwicket, it is not as far away from the fielder as the previous one, Hughes has to scramble back to make his gorund
some bounce there and doesn't turn away either, Smith is beaten by that one
tucked towards midwicket for a single
just outside off, pushed towards point
well outside off, Smith reaches out and taps the ball towards point
the typical Morne Morkel length, well outside off, slapped towards point, du Plessis attempts a diving one-handed stop but can only deflect the ball towards cover
angling in towards middle and off, Hughes stays in the crease and clips the ball in front of square leg
short of length and angling in, tapped towards deep midwicket for a couple, brings up another half-century, at a run a ball
fuller and outside off, Morkel continues from round the wicket, guided behind backward point

from over the wicket, Hughes pokes the ball towards point., he takes a step before deciding against the single, Smith had already taken off, and has to sprint back, Phangiso had already broken the stumps earlier, so a direct hit wouldn't have counted
pushed towards mid-on
pitched up and that is clipped towards midwicket for a single
spinning away just a touch after pitching on off, guided towards point
outside off, stabbed towards backward point after making some room
length ball, Hughes skips out of the crease and guides the ball towards long-on
Morkel cramps up Hughes from round the wicket, this ball is angling in and on the stumps, Hughes still wants to cut it, he can't, the ball drops at his feet
a bit more width this time, slapped towards backward point
angling in once more, back of a length ball, towards third man
length ball from over the wicket, worked towards midwicket for a single
bit of width, Hughes likes it there, thumps this towards sweeper cover for a single
short ball, slower as well, Smith shapes to hook but that is well above head height, Smith lets it go
overpitched outside off, a wristy whip sends the ball past midwicket
spinning in from round the wicket, guided towards short fine leg
length ball is swept firmly, along the ground, towards deep square
nudges this one towards backward square leg
skips down the track, Phangiso drops it shorter, defended by Smith
full ball on the pads, eased towards long-on for one
gets out of the crease to get near the pitch of the ball, can only push this length ball towards mid-on, no run
banged in short, Smith goes for the pull, he doesn't connect and is hit on the shoulder

short ball is pulled away... will that be caught at deep square leg, would have been if the fielder was on the rope, instead he is ten yards in, and the ball clears him and just clears the rope, it was McLaren in the deep
short of length ball heading for middle, Smith wants to work that to the leg side, but he can only defend to the right of the bowler
blocked to the off side this time
short of length ball on off stump, defended towards cover this time
defended towards silly point
turning towards the pads, defended to the leg side
tucked towards midwicket this time, three dots to start the over
length ball was drifting down, tucked towards square leg for a single
length ball spins away, Smith plays it inside-out towards long-off after taking a couple of paces down the track
tossed up, on a length, it is Hughes was dances down the pitch this time, eases the ball to long-on
gives this some air, plenty of air, it ends up as a high full toss, swatted towards deep midwicket, really should have got a boundary off that rubbish delivery
defended towards point by Hughes
spinning in from a length, turning towards off, slapped back towards the bowler
swept to deep backward square leg for a single
spins away outside off, steered to backward point off the back foot
flatter, quicker one, shortish and Smith can only defend that after charging down the track
short of length ball on the pads, can't get bat on it, the ball rolls towards square leg for a leg-bye
short of length ball is punched towards sweeper cover for a single
angling across, guided down to third man, Hughes wanted two, he starts for the second but Hughes sends him back
length ball on off stump, clipped towards deep square leg
short ball, pulled towards deep midwicket, takes care to keep that down
looks to pull that away, it wasn't too short from Steyn, sneaks under Smith's bat and goes through to the keeper
full toss is driven towards long-on for a single

Smith's innings is over, Tahir gets the breakthrough, Smith skips down the crease and looks to power the ball through the off side, and gets a thick outside edge, de Kock hangs on to that one, just about, it came off de Kock's right thigh pad initially, de Kock kept his cool to latch on
clipped towards midwicket
defended down the pitch this time
eased towards long-on for a single this time, Maxwell off the mark
length ball, flighted, Hughes sends this towards point
length ball just outside off, Hughes carves it towards backward point
short of length ball just outside off, guided down towards third man for a single
short of length and angling in, tucked towards square leg
short of length ball is steered towards third man for a single
shortish ball outside off, bottom edge as Maxwell looks to push the ball towards backward point, the ball bounces towards the keeper

the Powerplay has struck, as it usually does, Glenn Maxwell is gone, a short ball from Steyn, Maxwell goes for the pull, top edge and the ball goes high up, Steyn wants it, so does de Kock, who will take it? it is de Kock who gets it as Steyn stays away
well outside off and that is called a wide
full and wide outside off, slapped towards point
length ball on the pads, clipped towards square leg
angling in, length ball is defended towards the bowler
pitched up and that is driven towards cover by Bailey
short of length ball, pitching just outside off, defended towards point
a good-looking drive towards sweeper cover to end the over
length ball outside off, squeezed towards backward point, this is turning out to be a poor Powerplay for Australia
short of length ball, heading for middle and off, defended from the crease towards the bowler
similar delivery, around off stump this time, defended from the crease
digs this one towards short cover, Bailey wants the run to get him off the mark, Faf du Plessis pounces on that one but Hughes is quick enough to beat the throw
the Hughes cut brings him runs again, he charges out and clobbers that past point for four, is there any ball to which he can't play the cut?
full ball on the pads, Hughes whips that away for four more, behind backward point square leg, good contact on that one to beat the man in the deep
pitched up and that is pushed towards mid-on by Bailey
length ball angling in towards middle, clipped towards backward square leg
short of length from round the wicket, guided towards third man
pitched up and heading towards the pads, patted towards wide mid-on for a tight single, the throw comes in as Bailey hurries through, de Villiers' throw though hits the umpire Russell Tiffin
leading edge as Hughes wanted to tuck that to the leg side, the ball pops up to the off side, but doesn't carry to extra cover
pitched up and outside off, driven towards point
Phangiso given the final over of the Powerplay, Bailey pushes this towards mid-off for a single, it was a flighted, full delivery
full ball from over the wicket, sweeps after stepping out of the crease, towards backward square
pushed towards midwicket this time

Hughes couldn't get the previous two deliveries away, decides he has to go big now, takes on the man at long-on, it was a length ball that he wanted to club over the ropes, he can't get it as wide as he likes, picks out the fielder at long-on, this has been a disastrous Powerplay for Australia
full ball is pushed towards point
driven towards cover to end the over
eased towards long-on for a single
flighted delivery on the off stump, Marsh defends off the front foot
keeps bat and pad close as he blocks this to the off side
punches this one towards cover
length ball spinning away towards off, defended off the front foot
just one off the over as the final delivery is defended back towards the bowler
defended to the off side from deep within the crease
a touch short as he sees Bailey charge out, off the pads
down the track again, eased towards cover
whoah! close call for Bailey, the outside edge as Phangiso flights the ball and gets it to turn, a thick edge past the keeper, no slip, and that's a fortunate two for Bailey
defends this one with more confidence
full and on the pads, put away past short fine leg, poor delivery that given the field set
length ball pitching outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
spins past the bat, off the pads as Bailey looks to work that to the leg side
pushed back towards the bowler
short and down the leg side, you expect a few of these poor deliveries from Tahir every now and then, Bailey gets it away fine, past fine leg for four
Bailey taps this one from the crease
short of length, pitching on off stump, not turning much, defended to the leg side
length ball heading for the pads, eased towards mid-off for a single
flighted and full, driven towards long-off for one more
turn there for Phangiso, gets the edge as the ball zips away outside off, towards third man
fuller one, driven to short extra cover
waits on the back foot as he drives, can't find the gap near extra cover
flighted delivery, turns away outside off, lofted drive towards sweeper cover to end the over
full on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-on
comes down the track to charge and he gets the distance to loft it over long-n for six. He took it on the full and even tough there was a fielder in the deep
full on leg stump, swept to deep fine leg for one
on length on middle stump, pushed off the back foot to midwicket
comes down again to take it on full and tucks it to deep midwicket
flighted outside off, drives it with width to deeper cover
short of length outside off, inside edge nearly drags onto the stumps, rolls away to the keeper
tries a drive and gets another inside edge, this was one thicker and went towards the bowler
width on offer and it's driven properly to sweeper cover now
teasing line and length outside off, Bailey pokes and misses
shorter outside off, Bailey slices it late to third man for one
fuller and wider, Marsh tries an extravagant drive and it swings away to beat him
it's too short and Bailey rocks back to pull it behind square, finding the gap to the backward square leg boundary for a four

gone this time! He's been stumped, being beaten by the turn! Bailey charged down this time, despite hitting a four previous ball, going for a lofted drive for a ball on off stump but the ball turned away from him and QDK did the rest
on length on off stump, he leans forward to defend
touch shorter outside off, he goes back to punch it to cover, couldn't middle it
nearly plays himself on! The ball was going just outside off from length and Haddin got an inside edge, it hit his pad but he panicked and kicked it away from him towards cover point
slightly shorter to end the over, Haddin cuts it to deep point to keep strike
outside off on length, helped to third man easily for one
too short outside off this time, pulled easily to deep midwicket
on length quite a bit outside off and Haddin pokes but misses
fuller this time and Haddin drives it easily to deep cover
it's a tad full from length outside off and Marsh has found the wide gap between deep cover and third man for a four. It was not a powerful drive, but timed very well past point
back of length outside off, runs it down to third man for one
short of length outside off, offcutter comes in as he defends it back
flat and just outside off, pushed off the back foot
flat and short on middle stump this time, pushed down to long-on for one
flighted and fuller, pushed back to the bowler
on length outside off, driven with the turn to sweeper cover to bring up Australia's 200
towards middle and leg, tapped off the back foot to the leg side
fuller on middle stump, pushed down the ground to long-on for one
swat and a miss! It wasn't a very short ball outside off but Marsh went for a slog targeting the cow corner boundary but missed completely
short ball angled in towards the batsman, he makes room and taps it to cover for a quick single
just wide of slip! It was on length outside off and Haddin cut it pretty late to run it down and Amla nearly got a hand to it with his dive to catch it. Goes for four
that's what Steyn is known for! This one was teasing the batsman just outside off and beat Haddin completely as he looked to defend
goes towards leg stump this time and Haddin tucks it off is pad to square leg
give his room and Marsh produces a superb drive! It was not a half-volley but Marsh stood his ground and drove it handsomely over the cover for a powerful four
googly to start the over and looks like Haddin picked it to play the slog-sweep but could not middle it, for one
comes down the track and is beaten by a sharp googly which came in from outside off
quicker delivery this time as Marsh looks to attack again and is beaten again
he connects this time and goes all the away! Tahir pitched it fuller and Marsh took it on the full by coming down and launched it over long-on for six
quicker one on off stump, pushed down to long-on for one

oh, how was that? No, it's not an appeal! Haddin got into position early for a paddle sweep and Tahir offered a full toss close to Haddin's head, he was down on a knee, and he still swept it, but not for runs
oh, another one from Marsh! He plays these straight shots too well and with great timing! It was on length outside off and he tonked it straight down the ground for maximum
boom, another one! Steyn pitches it short to reply but Marsh swat-pulls it over long-on for one more six! He has some power
and another, and this one makes Steyn smile! This might have been on length but it was too wide and Marsh smahed it over long-off this time. What's the result? SIX!
too full and wide, Marsh chases and will this go for four? It's running to the third man boundary and the fielder there does well to save two runs
right on the money - yorker from Steyn and Marsh blocks it back
length delivery outside off, pushed away nicely to sweeper cover to keep strike and Marsh brings up his fifty
short and slightly outside off, it's swatted down the ground past the bowler by making room and oh it's gone for four! Long-on leaped to his left but could not stop it
one more, it's gone all the way! You can't bowl full to him, it was offered there outside off and whether there's no fielder at long-off, but it goes all the way
short ball this time but it's gone over his head for a wide
tries the yorker, and the full toss has been out away for four. Was on the pads and he flicked it away in the air and the ball nearly bounced over the fielder's head in the deep at midwicket
short ball with a scrambled seam outside off, he makes room and misses the pull
gets it right this time, one in the block hole well outside off and Marsh misses
slower ball and it's a wide full toss outside off, driven to deep point for one
low full toss outside off, punched down to long-on for one
too wide outside off and full, Haddin gets closer to it and misses and it's not called a wide. The umpire signals to Haddin saying he moved too much to the off side
Haddin falls in an attempt to collect runs like his partner. It was full outside off, he went for a lofted drive over the covers but got a leading edge and was caught at the edge of the circle
in the block hole and angled in, drives it down to long-on
slightly short of length outside off, pushed to cover to give strike to Marsh and it's a very risky single. But the fielder is deep in the circle and it's not a direct hit
he gets on strike and smashes a four! Got a full toss over waist height, it's called a no ball, and finds the gap behind square on the leg side for four
full just outside off, driven down to long on and he keeps strike
slower and nearly in the block hole outside off, it's a low full toss and it's driven to sweeper cover for one
another full toss outside off, pushed straight to cover but AB fumbles to collect it on first attempt
you can't get away all the time with full tosses! Third in a row and this is tonked over the long-off boundary for one more six! Doesn't matter to Marsh if there's a fielder in the deep or not
two in a row! MacLaren pitched it shorter outside off and he slapped it over the midwicket boundary this time. they have either pitched it up or too short to him and this is six more

excellent ball in the block hole, but Johnson's been run out for trying to run the second. Marsh dug it down to long-off and nearly lost his balance while playing the shot which and he lost time there. Johnson wanted to get Marsh back on strike but he was sent back and he could not get there on time
full delivery and it's driven down the ground to long-off for one to end the innings. Still got 16 from that over

inn2.comm: fullish and outside off, left easily by Amla
swinging in from length form outside off, Amla drives it firmly to cover
on the stumps this time, Amla goes back and turns it past midwicket

he hits middle stump, but with the return throw! De kock defended the length ball back to the bowler and was outside the crease and Johnson threw the ball back, it hit the batsman and uprooted the middle stump
swinging in from length outside off, QDK helps it towards midwicket for one
short of length on leg stump, he hops back to tuck it to square leg for one
Maxwell starts with a wide way down the leg side, too wide for Haddin as well, and that is five free runs
full ball is driven towards long-on for a single
Maxwell fires it towards the pads from round the wicket, defended to the leg side
full and wide, de Kock skips down the pitch and thumps it towards cover, can't beat the infield

Maxwell has got the wicket, the prolific de Kock is gone for 1, he went for the slog sweep, a top edge sends the ball high up and not too far from the pitch, Steve Smith gets under it and pouches the skier
spins in towards off, Faf defends from the crease
bounces outside off, Faf looks to cut but misses
Johnson bangs it back of a length, blocked back towards the bowler
shortish and outside off, pulls it away towards deep midwicket, not very well timed, and it was in the air for a bit, but enough on it to clear midwicket
full and angling across, Faf shoulders arms to that one
full and wide outside off, pushed towards cover
short of length ball on off stump, defended down the track
superb stroke from Faf to end the over, punched that between cover and extra cover for four, not much wrong with the delivery from Johnson, but he still concedes four
short of length ball on off stump, defended by Amla
length ball wide outside off, Amla latches on to that one, lashes it through the cover for four, too easy for Amla this
Amla shoulders arms to this one, which is closer to off and a touch shorter
length ball way outside off stump, Amla is happy to let that one through to the keeper
angling in towards off stump, back of a length ball, Amla defends from the crease
fuller and heading for middle and leg, Amla tucks this a touch awkwardly towards midwicket
short of length and just outside off, defended from the crease
angling across, left alone by Faf
short of length ball is mistimed towards mid-off
short ball, just down the leg side, batsman ducks under it
full ball on off stump, pushed towards covers
Faf just gets the bat down in time, inside-edged towards square leg, an appeal for lbw, a quick single is taken
opens the face as he blocks the ball towards point, it was on a length and outside off
outside off, Faf happy to allow it through to the keeper
even wider, just within the legal limit, another leave
taps this to backward point, straight towards the fielder but played with soft hands, time there for a single
full and outside off, lofted cover drive from Amla, again he doesn't exactly middle it, but he again gets enough on it clear the man in the ring
length ball on off stump, Amla gets forward and defends
again Faf not at his most convincing against Johnson, an inside edge down to fine leg, Johnson has his hands on his head, that could have easily taken leg stump
this time it just misses the inside edge as Amla looks to drive away from his body, no foot work either
short ball heading for Amla's head, Amla looks to hook that but misses, through to the keeper, a mild appeal for caught behind
Johnson bowling a superb over here, a full ball now, Amla is pegged back in the crease and he manages to dig that out
punched down the ground off the back foot, but not wide enough of mid-off
full ball just outside off, lovely work from Amla, shuffling across the stumps and clipping it down towards fine leg
length ball heading for off stump, defended by Faf to the leg side
Faf! that is an awesome shot, a touch short, it sits up, Faf flat bats that over extra cover for four, Faf just dismissed that one
pitched up and that is driven towards mid-off this time
back of a length ball, Faf opens the face to steer the ball towards backward point, 'Yes, yes, yes,' he shouts to Amla, calling him through for the single, though Maxwell makes a diving stop
shortish and outside off, dabbed to third man for an ambled single
shortish and outside off, Faf looks to chop that through the off, thick bottom edge as the ball bounces past the keeper
length ball outside off, defended towards short cover by Amla
superbly timed drive from Amla, but straight to mid-off, so no run
Amla looks to power this through the off, a back of a length ball outside off, he can't beat backward point
length ball on middle and leg, patted towards mid-on
driven towards point this time, Amla still can't get it away for runs
a maiden despite several attempts at form strokes, this one is driven on the up to short cover
starts with a length ball on off stump, guided towards point
again on a length, around off and middle, pushed towards extra cover for a quick single

stunning take from Haddin, throwing himself to his left to pluck a one-handed take, not bad for a 36-year-old that, Amla had moved across the stumps to try whip the ball down to fine leg, can only tickle it just wide of Haddin, or so he thought till that acrobatic leap from Haddin, and Marsh's day continues to get better
length ball on middle stump, AB de Villiers defends it back towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, defended to the leg side
short of length ball outside off, AB taking a couple of paces down the track, defended to the off side this time
length ball on off stump, blocked to the off side
fuller and outside off, guides this towards deep backward point
driven towards mid-on this time, straight at the fielder
length ball is driven towards mid-off this time, AB middling it but not finding the gaps
blocked towards point  by AB de Villiers
pitched up and heading down the leg side, big appeal for lbw but there was little chance of that being given, don't think it pitched in line either
Faf walks down the track and flat bats it towards mid-on
what a shot that is, comes down the track and flat bats a shortish ball over the bowler's head, lifts his back leg as he powers the ball towards the sightscreen
this time the ball is quicker on to him than he expected, hit high on the blade as he looks to pull, sends it towards deep midwicket
dinked towards third man for a single

and a repeat from Faf, this is another outstanding hit, takes a couple of steps down the track, gets near the pitch, lofts this over mid-off for six, again the exaggerated lift of the back foot, this isn't the most quickest of surfaces, which allows for this sort of shot
full ball outside off, Faf considers whether to whack this as well, then let's it goo
mistimes it as he looks to scythe it through cover
short of length ball on leg stump, nudged towards deep backward square leg to bring up South africa's 50
full and just outside off, driven towards mid-off off the front foot
short and wide, hit low on the bat but gets enough on it to clear the infield, over cover point
the yorker, on middle and leg, squeezed out to the right of the bowler
goes for the pull, was there a bottom edge there? doesn't matter as it bounces to the keeper, Starc smiles at the batsmen seeing the shot attempted and the result
length ball, defended off the front foot to the off side
pitched up and outside off, a bit of an edge towards cover, fielder puts in a dive but he can't make a clean stop
full ball, du Plessis had decided in advance that he was going to lap sweep that, he does for a single
length ball is driven towards extra cover by de Villiers
whips a full ball towards long-on
huge shout for lbw as Faf again looks to lap sweep, did that pitch in line? not sure it did
length ball on middle and leg, defended from the crease
full and well outside off, jabbed towards cover for a single
du Plessis' innings seems to consist of only one boundary-hitting shot, once more he skips out of the crease, thumps this over mid-off for four more
full and heading for off stump, driven towards extra cover, not fielded cleanly there allowing for the second
full and outside off, Faf doesn't offer a stroke
full and just outside off once more, driven firmly towards cover
Lyon continues from round the wicket, spinning down the leg side, tucked towards midwicket
down the track as he pushes the ball towards square leg
swept firmly towards square leg

swept once more, this time in the air, taken at backward square leg, perhaps AB wanted to hit that over the fielder there, but instead he hits it straight at his chest, easy for Bailey, a massive wicket this, South Africa in a hole now, with their three most prolific batsmen in recent series gone, this is a test for middle and lower-middle order
bit of turn outside off from length, Duminy defends off the back foot
full outside off, JPD drives it down past cover to get off the mark
from outside leg, tucked off the back foot to midwicket
short of length from outside leg again, he defends it back to the bowler
on length and angling away form outside off, drives it to short cover
towards off stump this time, he defends it back
back to the leg stump line, runs it down to fine leg for one
touch short of length and Faf stays back to whip it off his pads to square leg for one
flighted around off, Faf paddle-sweeps it to short fine leg for one
on length with some turn, JPD defends with soft hands on the off side
short of length on middle and turning away, JPD goes back and defends on the leg side
similar length on the off stump, he goes back again to defend after the turn
flighted on middle stump, pushes it back to the bowler
flighted and full on the of stump, drives it down to long-off for one
on length and angling away from outside off, helps it to third man for one
back of length outside off, punched off the back foot on the off side
back of length and angling in, sliced to third man late by Faf
on length on middle and leg, defends it back to the bowler, bit of extra bounce there
shorter and a bit wider outside off, cuts it late to third man for one
back of length and towards the stumps, Faf defends it back
flighted on middle stump on length, he goes back and defends on the off side
flighted on the leg stump now, turned straight to backward square leg
fuller on off, takes a step down to push it to midwicket
tossed up on middle and off, drives it down to long-off easily
comes down the pitch and makes it a full toss to drive it in the gap through the covers for four. Nobody in the deep and he found the gap pretty well, taking one hand off the bat towards the end
takes a step down again and tucks the ball to deep midwicket for one
short ball and it's pulled straight to deep square leg after a bounce
short of length from middle and swinging away, defends off the back foot towards cover point
touch shorter outside off, taps it off the back foot to point. Maxwell grabbed the ball there and tried a direct hit at the non-striker's end, had it hit Faf would have been out
outside leg now and it's helped to deep fine leg, a bit wide actually, and they run quickly for two
length delivery on middle and off, JPD defends it back
back of length on the pads, turned to deep midwicket. The fielder is so deep they come back for two
full on middle and leg, flicked in the air past midwicket for one
comes down the track and whips it against the turn from outside off just over midwicket for four in the gap
flighted just outside off, pushed towards point for one
flatter on off stump, paddle-swept to fine leg by Faf
on length just outside off, swishes it to backward point

loud appeal for lbw, but not given! JPD went back a long way for this one that pitched on middle and it didn't turn, was going with the angle, but when it hit JPD on the back foot, the leg stump was visible. A very lucky Duminy also got a leg bye
length delivery on middle stump is defended back
on length on off now, he stays back to defend it again
back of length outside off, gives JPD time to run it down to third man
handsome drive from Faf for the full delivery outside off, but there's a fielder in the deep

oh, Duminy has handed a simple catch to fine leg! Marsh pitched it short outside leg and Duminy pulled it, but not with much power, maybe he wanted to pull it finer and the fielder took a couple of steps in and caught it easily. Had he been at the boundary, it would have fallen short
swinging in a bit, it as almost in the block hole on off, Faf digs it out
goes down the leg side with the angle for a wide
on length outside off, pushed past point gently but it's well in the gap and they have time to come back for three
length delivery on off stump, he defends it back
flighted outside leg and it's paddle swept fine on the leg side, they come back for two
tossed up on off stump, driven down the ground to long-off and that brings up his fifty
length delivery outside off, pushed to cover and that's the first time Miller has played more than a ball in this series
brings it in with the angle from off, Miller goes back and defends on the off side
short of length and angled in, he defends it back
short of length from outside off, pulled to deep midwicket for one
length delivery around off stump, Miller defends it back

that's a Johnson special, Miller's stumps have gone for a walk! It was well short of length and very quick from outside off, Miller didn't move his feet much and looked to push it but it came in, beat him by pace and rattled the stumps through the huge gap between bat and pad
stifled appeal as Johnson tries a yorker but it's going down leg and the ball goes down to fine leg after hitting McLaren's foot
back of length from outside off, nearly whipped, but he defends it to midwicket
bit of flight on length outside off, he defends by leaning forward
touch fuller and it's pushed towards cover point where the fielder gets to it in a flash and sends McLaren back
fuller on leg stump, tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
short of length on middle and leg, tapped off the back foot to deep midwicket
flighted outside off, driven off the front foot to short cover
length delivery on middle and off, taps it to point with the turn
length delivery from wide of the crease, it's full and Faf guides it to point
on length outside off again, he rolled his fingers over this one which made it slow and Faf gets a thick edge to third man
tries the yorker, it's too quick and goes down leg for a wide. Good take by Haddin
towards middle and leg this time, tucked with the angle to the leg side
angled in sharply towards middle stump on length, Faf blocks it
he takes a step down for the short ball and adjusts well to pull it to deep midwicket in the gap for two
angled in towards the batsman, it's gone to midwicket after a thick inside edge
slow through the air outside off, pushed off the back foot towards cover
Haddin ran a long way towards leg gully to catch that! Faf tried the paddle sleep and Haddin ran early in anticipation but it fell just outside his reach after going off the bat and pad
goes with the angle, doesn't turn as Faf goes back and defends it on the back foot outside off stump
flighted on middle and Faf middles it this time, and in the gap! Went down on a knee and slept it with the turn to the backward square leg boundary
takes a step down and takes it on the pad outside off
outside off this time and Faf has enough time to sweep it again to the wide gap between fine leg and midwicket for another four!
tries another yorker and he hits McLaren's pad outside the leg stump with a full delivery

oh, what pace can do! McLaren is hit on the arm this time, it was a short delivery towards the batsman, he hardly had time to react and ducked a bit, taking his eyes off the ball, which hit him on the arm
solid defence this time for the delivery outside off on length

loud lbw appeal as he's hit on the back pad for the ball that was angled in from outside off. The ball might have been a bit too high as Aleem Dar didn't react much. Not much footwork from the batsman
fuller on middle and leg, pushed down the ground to mid-on
beaten again as the ball comes in towards the pad, he looked to flick it off the pad but missed and the ball strayed to the off side
a bit of flight on middle and leg, tucked off the pad to square leg
short and wide outside off and there's enough time for him to go back and punch it to sweeper cover
turning in from just outside off, Faf goes back and helps it with the turn to fine leg
flighted on middle and it's pushed back to the bowler, nearly carried to the bowler
quicker one towards leg stump and it goes towards point after an edge
full on off stump, drives it down to long-on to end the over
what a shot! Scintillating shot from Faf as he came down the track and took it on the full to loft it very high and long over long-on for a massive six
much closer to middle and leg, tucked off the back foot towards midwicket
full and just outside off, pushed down to mid-off off the front foot
cutting in a little bit from off, turned to square leg for one
tries a yorker, it's a low full toss on off stump, pushed down to long-off for one
angled in towards the batsman's pads, it's tucked to fine leg where a fumble gives them a chance for the second
bit of flight on middle stump, turned to midwicket
flighted on off this time and Faf does what he does very well, paddle sweeps it fine on the leg side for two
tries another paddle sweep and nearly yorks himself, he pulled out at the end and dug it out towards backward square leg
he's not going to stop them - another paddle sweep and this time they get three because of a fumble at fine leg by Steven Smith
straight down the ground and that's a handsome one from McLaren! It was full on off and he drove it down the ground, with a straight bat over the bowler's head for a four. There's nobody in the deep
leans forward this time to defend the length delivery
angled in from round the wicket, Faf defends it to the off side
on length and well outside off, Faf looked to tap it but the ball held its line and bounced a bit extra
takes a step down and defends the length ball back to the bowler
charges down the ground and that's a powerful and flat six! He came down and took the ball as a half-volley to smash it over the bowler's head for a flat six
responds with a short ball and it's pulled to deep midwicket
swinging in from outside off, McLaren defends and an inside edge goes close to leg stump after hitting the pad and they take a quick single
whipping it against the turn from outside off, it chips in the air between cover point and point for one
flighted just outside off, tapped to square leg with the turn for one
beaten! McLaren's defence is beaten with the turn after it pitched outside off and Haddin whips the bails too, but his back foot is in the crease
tries a slog sweep this time for this one that pitched outside off, missed it again
fuller on middle and off, it's pushed straight to cover
tossed up even more on middle stump, pushed down firmly to long-off past Lyon
length delivery around off stump, taps it close on the pitch on the leg stump and calls for a single early
just wide of short midwicket! Marsh pitched it up towards leg stump, making Faf flick and it went to the left of a diving short midwicket
stays back and defends the length ball back to the bowler
tries to drive the full delivery outside off but can't middle it
short of length on middle stump and he looked to whip it on the leg side, but got an inside edge on his thigh pad
fuller outside off, pushed with the angle to sweeper cover for one
drifts it in towards middle stump from outside off, turned away to midwicket for one
Faf goes back in the crease for the ball to turn and tucks it to backward square leg
loud appeal for lbw as McLaren tries the reverse sweep! the ball pitched on leg stump and turned towards middle, was probably high but it looked close
fuller on leg stump, driven down to long-on for one
goes to the back foot for the ball that comes towards off stump, he defends towards short cover

makes room and Faf plays those very well! He moved way outside leg stump early and cashed in on the full delivery, it was full too, and executed a stunning inside-out lofted drive over long-off for six. Moves to 97 now
angled in towards the batsman who defends it back
fuller outside of and it's turned with the wrists to mid-on
short of length and coming in, tapped to backward point late off the back foot
top edge goes for four! He banged it in for a bouner and McLaren hooked and managed a thick top edge just down the leg side for four
on length from outside off, pushed to cover this time
goes for a heave and hands it to midwicket! It was slightly full outside off stump and he went for a cross-batted heave to the leg side, didn't middle and it went straight to Steven Smith
bangs it in from wide of the crease, round the wicket, tapped towards backward point. Steyn on strike straightaway
the bounce surprises Steyn! Starc pitched it short of length from outside off and Steyn thought it was a bouncer, swaying away, and defended it awkwardly
back of length outside off, he defends it towards cover point
strays down the leg side, it was full too, and goes fine off the pad on the leg side, just beating a diving Haddin
back of length well outside off, tapped without any footwork to third man
bouncer outside off and Faf pulls it softly past midwicket for one to bring up his second ODI hundred, both against Australia in this series. Punches the air and gets a hug from Dale Steyn
nearly loses his off stump! Takes a step down to smash it on the leg side but misses it completely and the short of length ball that came in almost kissed the top of off stump
makes room and gets a full toss too! What does he do, lofts it pretty easily over the covers for four. It's the Powerplay so nobody's in the deep
makes room again, he pitches it short of length and Faf struck it powerfully but straight to cover point at the edge of the circle
nearly played on now! Tries to force the wide delivery outside off through the covers but gets an inside edge just past the stumps
he can bat too! Steyn clears his front foot out of the way and smashes the length delivery through the covers for a four
much shorter and slower outside off, Steyn tries a pull and misses this time
on the leg side this time, will he be caught, no it goes all the way! Short of length and angled in towards leg stump, Faf crashed it to the midwicket boundary even though there was a fielder there
and another! He's doing a Mitchell Marsh here! Fuller from Starc and he tonked this one over the long-on boundary. He either connects them for six, or misses them. Nothing in between
slow bouncer outside off, swats it down to long-on for one
he goes way down the leg side and Starc chases him, gets hit on the pad for a leg bye
pulled again, with some power, and this short ball goes to deep midwicket after a bounce
swinging yorker on middle and leg, Steyn blocks it back
slightly slow and full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on for one
put down, but that was a very tough chance! The short of length ball on leg was slapped back to Johnson who barely had any time to react but got his left hand to it

gone, Steyn is run out! He punched the ball down to mid-off and took off to give strike to Faf, but the ball reached Smith in no time and he struck the stumps with a direct hit and so much power that one of them broke!
angled towards the leg stump, helped off the back foot wide of short fine leg for two
slow and wide outside off, left by the batsman for a side even though Faf tried to chase it
makes room to loft it over the covers but the ball comes slower than expected and the bat turns in his hand, the ball goes in the air towards long-on

keeps low and oh, nearly a run out! The inside edge went to short fine leg and Phangiso wanted the single but Faf didn't know where the ball went. He realised it was too risky and sent Phangiso back and the throw wasn't accurate to run him out
on length well outside off, tapped straight to cover point
short of length outside off, runs it down to third man for one
outside off and Faf stays back to whip it to deep midwicket, who's pretty deep and he called early for two
makes room again and he survives again! He went a long way down leg to push the short of length ball on off, he missed and the ball also missed the stumps

oh, he's hitwicket, what a way for that innings to end! Faf went back in the crease to turn the ball to deep midwicket from outside off and set off for a single too, but his right heel touched the base of the off stump and he has to walk back. He has a word with Phangiso before leaving the field
short of length outside off, pushed down to mid-off off the back foot

that lands in no man's land! It was a bouncer from Johnson, the pull came a little late and a top edge went high towards the backward short leg area, the keeper ran, square leg ran but it fell in the middle
short again, tapped to the leg side off the toes
fuller on the stumps, pushed down to mid-on for one
bangs it in short from wide of the crease and that's gone over Morkel's head for a wide
another wide - this one down the leg side and Haddin does very well to save four more extra runs with his right hand

that's gone through, bowled'im! What a difference pace can make! the length delivery came in from just outside off and it didn't give Morkel any time to move his feet, he tried to drive it down but missed it completely
brings this one in sharply from outside off, thick outside edge goes to the off side
angled in towards the leg stump, it's tucked towards midwicket for a single
short on the pads, the batsman moves back and tucks it behind square
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
not short enough to cut but he tries it anyway, ends up playing it awkwardly on the off side
defended towards midwicket
the length is short once again, the batsman goes back and works the ball through midwicket

it's all over, Tahir has been caught at deep cover and Australia enter the finals of the tri-series with a bonus-point win. He freed his arms and lofted to ball over cover but only got as far as Mitchell Marsh
